comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Pic taken during the England vs Australia Test Match held at the Sydney Cricket Ground from 26 February 1898 - 2 March 1898...this pic was evidently taken on Saturday the 26th February 1898...Here's Kerry's pic as it appeared in the Australian Town & Country Journal - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71283995 ; Cricket tragics will tell you that this was the game in which the English fast bowler Tom Richardson took 8 for 94 off 36.1 overs to put England in the box seat after the first innings, and where Joe Darling scored a brilliant 160 in the second innings to help Australia come from behind and win by 6 wickets. The result was a big turn-around from the first test of the series held at Sydney in December 1897, where England won by 9 wickets, with both Maclaren and Ranjitsinhji (who was sick) making centuries, and Hearne taking 9 wickets for the match. Despite being hammered first up, Australia won all the remaining matches of the series by significant margins, wrapping things up 4-1. To an extent, this 1897-1898 series was marred by the bad behaviour of the Australian crowds, who relentlessly hooted the English team in what was then considered to be an unsporting manner. Ranjitsinhji, in particular, incurred the wrath of the crowds following comments he made in the press about Australian fast bowler Ernie Jones, whose bowling action was deemed by many to be questionable. Jones was in fact no-balled for throwing during the second test at Melbourne. For the English team, one of the biggest disappointments of the tour was the poor form of fast bowler Tom Richardson, who was evidently plagued by fitness and alcohol related issues. Richardson has often been regarded as one of the best fast bowlers ever to play the game, but by 1897-1898 his career was in decline.
